description.narrative: Output 8.3: By 2018, central and decentralised public services, private institutions and civil society responsible for statistics and/or research have strengthened capacities to produce and promote the use of evidence in advocacy, planning, monitoring and evaluation in key areas related to the protection and promotion of the rights of the child and equity, which contributes to Child Poverty / Public Finance For Children, Cross-Sectoral Monitoring, Data And Situation Analyses, Cross-Sectoral Planning And Programme Reviews, Evaluation And Research, Social Exclusion â€“ Data And Evidence, Social Protection, Social Protection And Child Poverty. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Evaluations, Research And Data, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Outcome 8: By 2018, children, especially the most disadvantaged enjoy better recognition of their rights in national and local development policies, strategies and programmes as well as through allocations of public resources.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Output 8.3: By 2018, central and decentralised public services, private institutions and civil society responsible for statisticsand/or research have strengthened capacities to produce and promote the use of evidence in advocacy, planning, monitoring andevaluation in key areas related to the protection and promotion of the rights of the child and equity

description.narrative: Significant data quality issues affect the national statistic systems as well as routine information systems in key social sectors (education, health, population). However, the national database added additional indicators, as well as their metadata and baseline where possible to monitor progress in PDES 2 and the SDG. | Status:Partially Met | As-of Date:31/01/2019

title.narrative: Number of regions producing annual Regions in figures brochures and/or socio-economic dashboards using DevInfo for monitoring progress in implementing regional development plans.
Existence of a national indicator for measuring multidimensional child poverty in monitoring the implementation of the Economic and Social Development Plan as well as SDGs monitoring.
Number of social sectors (line ministries) whose information systems are regularly (at least annually) updated after a validation process that includes data quality check.
(NOT VALID after Dec 31 2017) Existence of disaggregated national household survey data on child-focused targets of SDGs collected within the preceding 5 years
